Class DefaultConfig

java.lang.Object
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.config.BlockProtConfig
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.config.DefaultConfig
public final class DefaultConfig extends BlockProtConfig
The default config of the BlockProt plugin.

      0.3.3

  • Method Details

    • getLanguageFile

      @Nullable public @Nullable String getLanguageFile()
      Get the filename of the language file we use. This file should be located in /plugins/BlockProt/.
      Returns:
      The name of the language file.
      Since:
      0.3.3

    • shouldReplaceTranslations

      public boolean shouldReplaceTranslations()
      Whether we should replace the translation files on each startup and therefore discard any potential changes made to the files by the server admin.
      Returns:
      True if translation files should be replaced.

    • shouldNotifyOpOfUpdates

      public boolean shouldNotifyOpOfUpdates()
      Whether or not to we should notify a OP player of any updates when they join the server.
      Returns:
      True if a op should be notified of updates.
      Since:
      0.3.3

    • disallowRedstoneOnPlace

      public boolean disallowRedstoneOnPlace()
      Checks the config if the "redstone_disallowed_by_default" key is set to true. If it was not found, it defaults to false.
      Returns:
      True if redstone should be automatically disabled when a block is placed.
      Since:
      0.3.3

    • isWorldExcluded

      public boolean isWorldExcluded(org.bukkit.World world)
      Checks if given world should be excluded from any block protection functionality.
      Parameters:
      world - The world to check for.
      Returns:
      If true, we shall not allow players to own and protect any blocks in given world.
      Since:
      0.4.4

    • isWorldExcluded

      public boolean isWorldExcluded(org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryHolder holder)
      Checks if the world of the block held by inventory is excluded from any block protection functionality.
      Parameters:
      holder - The inventory we want to use. If it is not a known exception, we try to cast it to BlockInventoryHolder.
      Returns:
      True, if the world is excluded or the holder was unable to be cast to BlockInventoryHolder and we do not know how to extract the World information from it. This is done to prevent this plugin to, for example, interact with other plugins' inventories.
      Since:
      0.4.5

    • lockOnPlaceByDefault

      public boolean lockOnPlaceByDefault()
      Whether the lock on place setting should be enabled by default.
      Returns:
      Boolean for the default value of lock on place.
      Since:
      0.4.11

    • publicIsFriendByDefault

      public boolean publicIsFriendByDefault()
      Whether the public should be a friend by default.
      Returns:
      Boolean for the default value of public is friend.
      Since:
      1.1.15

    • getTranslationFallbackString

      @Nullable public @Nullable String getTranslationFallbackString()
      Since:

    • getMaxLockedBlockCount

      @Nullable public @Nullable Integer getMaxLockedBlockCount()
      Gets the maximum amount of blocks a player is allowed to lock globally.
      Returns:
      The value or if no limit is set, null.
      Since:
      1.0.3

    • removeBlockDefaults

      public void removeBlockDefaults()
      JavaPlugin#reloadConfig sets the default values to the config inside the JAR, which are never edited by the player. We don't want this for the lists.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getLockHintCooldown

      public long getLockHintCooldown()

    • getFriendSearchSimilarityPercentage

      public double getFriendSearchSimilarityPercentage()
      Gets the minimum percentage friend names have to match by the levenshtein distance.
      Since:
      1.1.6

    • isFriendFunctionalityDisabled

      public boolean isFriendFunctionalityDisabled()
      Returns if the friend functionality is fully disabled. This will no longer allow players to give other players access to their blocks, and current settings are ignored until re-activated.
      Since:
      1.1.16

    • isLockable

      public boolean isLockable(org.bukkit.Material type)

      Whether the given type is either a lockable block or a lockable tile entity.

      Keep in mind, that only tile entities are lockable through this plugin after Spigot 1.16_R3.

      To add to this, this merely checks the material from the config. This means that a server author might accidentally add a material which is not a block or tile entity.

      Parameters:
      type - The type to check for.
      Returns:
      True, if type is lockable.
      Since:
      0.3.3

    • isLockableBlock

      public boolean isLockableBlock(org.bukkit.Material type)
      Whether the given type is a lockable block. Be aware, this only works after Spigot 1.16_R3 and the config might have some invalid values.
      Parameters:
      type - The material to check for.
      Returns:
      True, if type is a lockable block.
      Since:
      0.3.3
      See Also:
      • isLockable(Material)

    • isLockableTileEntity

      public boolean isLockableTileEntity(org.bukkit.Material type)
      Whether the given type is a lockable tile entity. Be aware, the config might have some invalid values.
      Parameters:
      type - The material to check for.
      Returns:
      True, if type is a lockable tile entity.
      Since:
      0.3.3
      See Also:
      • isLockable(Material)
